alert.note: Alert for Coastal Palm Beach County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Palm Beach County through 1115 PM EDT... At 1043 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Boca Raton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boca Raton, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Ocean Ridge, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Village Of Golf, Kings Point, Dunes Road, Whisper Walk, Mission Bay, Gulf Stream, Briny Breezes, Manalapan, Fau South Campus, Boca West, Morikami Park and Villages Of Oriole. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
